<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Takashi_Amano&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8" title="Edit section: References">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div class="reflist" style="list-style-type: decimal;">

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="External_links">External links</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Takashi_Amano&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9" title="Edit section: External links">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>

<table class="box-Peacock plainlinks metadata ambox ambox-content ambox-peacock" role="presentation"><tbody><tr><td class="mbox-image"><div style="width:52px"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/40px-Ambox_important.svg.png" decoding="async" width="40" height="40" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/60px-Ambox_important.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/80px-Ambox_important.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="40" data-file-height="40" /></div></td><td class="mbox-text"><div class="mbox-text-span">This article contains wording that <b><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Manual_of_Style/Words_to_watch#Puffery" title="Wikipedia:Manual of Style/Words to watch">promotes the subject in a subjective manner</a> without imparting real information</b>.<span class="hide-when-compact"> Please remove or replace such wording and instead of making proclamations about a subject's importance, use facts and attribution to demonstrate that importance.</span>  <small class="date-container"><i>(<span class="date">April 2010</span>)</i></small><small class="hide-when-compact"><i> (<a href="/wiki/Help:Maintenance_template_removal" title="Help:Maintenance template removal">Learn how and when to remove this template message</a>)</i></small></div></td></tr></tbody></table>
    </div>
</div><small class="hide-when-compact"><i> (<a href="/wiki/Help:Maintenance_template_removal" title="Help:Maintenance template removal">Learn how and when to remove this template message</a>)</i></small></div></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p class="mw-empty-elt">

</p>
<table class="infobox vcard" style="width:22em"><tbody><tr><th colspan="2" style="text-align:center;font-size:125%;font-weight:bold;font-size: 100%;"><div style="display:inline-block; font-size:130%;" <a href="/wiki/Lok_Sabha" title="Lok Sabha">Lok Sabha</a></th></tr><tr><td colspan="2" style="text-align:center;border-bottom:none"><span class="nowrap"><b>In office</b></span><br href="/wiki/Pandurang_Pundalik_Fundkar" title="Pandurang Pundalik Fundkar">Pandurang Pundalik Fundkar</a></td></tr><tr><th scope="row" style="text-align:left">Constituency</th><td><a parliament</a> of <a href="/wiki/Rajya_Sabha" title="Rajya Sabha">Rajya Sabha</a></th></tr><tr><td colspan="2" style="text-align:center;border-bottom:none"><span class="nowrap"><b>In </td></tr><tr><th colspan="2" style="text-align:center;background:lavender">Personal details</th></tr><tr><th scope="row">Born</th><td><span style="display:none"> (<span class="bday">1954-05-10</span>) </span>10 May 1954<span class="noprint ForceAgeToShow"> (age&#160;66)</span><br /><a href="/wiki/Bombay" class="mw-redirect" title="Bombay">Bombay</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bombay_State" title="Bombay State">Bombay State</a> (now <a href="/wiki/Mumbai" title="Mumbai">Mumbai</a>, <a href="/wiki/Maharashtra" title="Maharashtra">Maharashtra</a>), India</td></tr><tr><th scope="row">Nationality</th><td><a href="/wiki/India" title="India">Indian</a></td></tr><tr><th scope="row">Political party</th><td><div class="plainlist"><ul><li><a href="/wiki/Republican_Party_of_India" title="Republican Party of India">Republican Party of India</a><br />(before 1994, 1998 – 1999)</li><li><a href="/wiki/Bharipa_Bahujan_Mahasangh" title="Bharipa Bahujan Mahasangh">Bharipa Bahujan Mahasangh</a><br />(1994 – 2019)</li><li><a href="/wiki/Vanchit_Bahujan_Aghadi" class="mw-redirect" title="Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi">Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi</a><br />(since 2019)</li></ul></div></td></tr><tr><th scope="row">Spouse(s)</th><td><div style="display:inline;white-space:nowrap;"><div style="display:inline-block;line-height:normal;">Anjali Ambedkar</div>&#32;<div style="display:inline-block;">&#8203;</div>&#40;<abbr title="married">m.</abbr>&#160;1993&#41;<wbr />&#8203;</div></td></tr><tr><th scope="row">Relations</th><td><div class="plainlist"><ul><li><a href="/wiki/B._R._Ambedkar" title="B. R. Ambedkar">B. R. Ambedkar</a><br />(grandfather)</li><li><a href="/wiki/Anandraj_Ambedkar" title="Anandraj Ambedkar">Anandraj Ambedkar</a><br />(brother)</li><li><a href="/wiki/Anand_Teltumbde" title="Anand Teltumbde">Anand Teltumbde</a><br />(brother-in-law)</li><li>See also <b><a href="/wiki/Ambedkar_family" title="Ambedkar family">Ambedkar family</a></b></li></ul></div></td></tr><tr><th scope="row">Children</th><td>Sujat Ambedkar (son)</td></tr><tr><th scope="row">Parents</th><td><div class="plainlist"><ul><li><a href="/wiki/Yashwant_Ambedkar" title="Yashwant Ambedkar">Yashwant Ambedkar</a></li><li>Meera Ambedkar</li></ul></div></td></tr><tr><th scope="row">Residence</th><td class="label">&#160;&#8226;&#32; 129, <a href="/wiki/Rajgruha" title="Rajgruha">Rajgruha</a>, <a href="/wiki/Hindu_colony" title="Hindu colony">Hindu colony</a>, <a href="/wiki/Dadar" title="Dadar">Dadar</a>, <a href="/wiki/Mumbai" title="Mumbai">Mumbai</a>, <a href="/wiki/Maharashtra" title="Maharashtra">Maharashtra</a><br /> &#160;&#8226;&#32; B-17,  Patil Heritage Bhosale Nagar, <a href="/wiki/Pune" title="Pune">Pune</a>, <a href="/wiki/Maharashtra" title="Maharashtra">Maharashtra</a><br /> &#160;&#8226;&#32; <a href="/wiki/Akola" title="Akola">Akola</a>, <a href="/wiki/Maharashtra" title="Maharashtra">Maharashtra</a></td></tr><tr><th scope="row">Education</th><td><a href="/wiki/Bachelor_of_Arts" title="Bachelor of Arts">Bachelor of Arts</a> <br /> <a href="/wiki/Bachelor_of_Laws" title="Bachelor of Laws">Bachelor of Laws</a></td></tr><tr><th scope="row"><a href="/wiki/Alma_mater" title="Alma mater">Alma mater</a></th><td><a href="/wiki/St._Stanislaus_High_School" title="St. Stanislaus High School">St. Stanislaus High School</a><br /> <a href="/wiki/Siddharth_College_of_Law,_Mumbai" title="Siddharth College of Law, Mumbai">Siddharth College of Law, Mumbai</a></td></tr><tr><th scope="row">Profession</th><td><a href="/wiki/Advocate" title="Advocate">Advocate</a>, <a href="/wiki/Politician" title="Politician">Politician</a>,  Social worker</td></tr><tr><th scope="row">Website</th><td><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.facebook.com/PrakashAmbedkar.Official">PrakashAmbedkar</a> on Facebook</td></tr><tr><th scope="row">Nickname(s)</th><td>Balasaheb Ambedkar</td></tr></tbody></table>
<p><b>Prakash Yashwant Ambedkar</b> (<a href="/wiki/IAST" class="mw-redirect" title="IAST">IAST</a>: Prakāśa Yaśavanta Āmbēḍakar) (born 10 May 1954), popularly known as <b>Balasaheb Ambedkar</b>, is an Indian politician, social activist, writer and lawyer. He is the president of <a href="/wiki/Political_party" title="Political party">political party</a> called the <a href="/wiki/Vanchit_Bahujan_Aghadi" class="mw-redirect" title="Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi">Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi</a>. He is a three-time <a href="/wiki/Member_of_parliament_(India)" title="Member of parliament (India)">Member of Parliament</a> (MP). He is the grandson of <a href="/wiki/B._R._Ambedkar" title="B. R. Ambedkar">B. R. Ambedkar</a>. He was a member of the <a href="/wiki/11th_Lok_Sabha" title="11th Lok Sabha">12th</a> and <a href="/wiki/13th_Lok_Sabha" title="13th Lok Sabha">13th Lok Sabha</a> Akola constituency of <a href="/wiki/India" title="India">India</a>. He has served in both houses of the <a href="/wiki/Indian_Parliament" class="mw-redirect" title="Indian Parliament">Indian Parliament</a>.
</p>
<div id="toc" class="toc" role="navigation" aria-labelledby="mw-toc-heading"><input type="checkbox" role="button" id="toctogglecheckbox" class="toctogglecheckbox" style="display:none" /><div class="toctitle" lang="en" dir="ltr"><h2 id="mw-toc-heading">Contents</h2><span class="toctogglespan"><label class="toctogglelabel" for="toctogglecheckbox"></label></span></div>

</div>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Personal_life">Personal life</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Prakash_Yashwant_Ambedkar&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" title="Edit section: Personal life">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>Prakash Ambedkar is the eldest grandson of <a href="/wiki/B._R._Ambedkar" title="B. R. Ambedkar">B. R. Ambedkar</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ramabai_Bhimrao_Ambedkar" title="Ramabai Bhimrao Ambedkar">Ramabai Ambedkar</a>. His father's name is <a href="/wiki/Yashwant_Ambedkar" title="Yashwant Ambedkar">Yashwant Ambedkar</a> (Bhaiyasaheb) and mother's name is Meera. The <a href="/wiki/Ambedkar_family" title="Ambedkar family">Ambedkar family</a> are followers of <a href="/wiki/Navayana" title="Navayana">Navayana Buddhism</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2">&#91;2&#93;</a></sup> He has two younger brothers Bhimrao and <a href="/wiki/Anandraj_Ambedkar" title="Anandraj Ambedkar">Anandraj</a>, and a sister Ramabai who is married to <a href="/wiki/Anand_Teltumbde" title="Anand Teltumbde">Anand Teltumbde</a>. Prakash Ambedkar is married to Anjali Maydeo, with whom he has a son.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3">&#91;3&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Early_life_and_education">Early life and education</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Prakash_Yashwant_Ambedkar&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" title="Edit section: Early life and education">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>Prakash Ambedkar was born on 10 May 1954 in <a href="/wiki/Bombay" class="mw-redirect" title="Bombay">Bombay</a> (now <a href="/wiki/Mumbai" title="Mumbai">Mumbai</a>). In 1972 he completed his higher secondary education from <a href="/wiki/St._Stanislaus_High_School" title="St. Stanislaus High School">St. Stanislaus High School</a>, Mumbai. In 1978, he received <a href="/wiki/Bachelor_of_Arts" title="Bachelor of Arts">Bachelor of Arts</a> (BA) from Siddhartha College of Arts, and in 1981 he got <a href="/wiki/Bachelor_of_Laws" title="Bachelor of Laws">Bachelor of Laws</a> (LLB) in <a href="/wiki/Siddharth_College_of_Law,_Mumbai" title="Siddharth College of Law, Mumbai">Siddharth College of Law, Mumbai</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4">&#91;4&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Political_career">Political career</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Prakash_Yashwant_Ambedkar&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" title="Edit section: Political career">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>On 4 July 1994, Prakash Ambedkar established the <a href="/wiki/Bharipa_Bahujan_Mahasangh" title="Bharipa Bahujan Mahasangh">Bharipa Bahujan Mahasangh</a>. This party was a splintered group amongst other factions of the <a href="/wiki/Republican_Party_of_India" title="Republican Party of India">Republican Party of India</a> which was constituted on directions of his grandfather after his death. The Bharipa Bahujan Mahasangha contested established political parties like <a href="/wiki/Indian_National_Congress" title="Indian National Congress">Indian National Congress</a>, <a href="/wiki/Shiv_Sena" title="Shiv Sena">Shiv Sena</a> and <a href="/wiki/Bharatiya_Janata_Party" title="Bharatiya Janata Party">Bharatiya Janata Party</a> in the Akola municipal elections, emerging victorious. The success was gained through the new social engineering brought by Prakash Ambedkar which later known as "Akola Pattern". The expansion of the party continued after 1995, that some of the non-Dalit parties and organisations have joined the Bharipa Bahujan Mahasangh.<sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5">&#91;5&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-6">&#91;6&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Ambedkar was a member of the <a href="/wiki/Rajya_Sabha" title="Rajya Sabha">Rajya Sabha</a> during 1990 - 1996.<sup id="cite_ref-rajyasabha1_7-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-rajyasabha1-7">&#91;7&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-8">&#91;8&#93;</a></sup> He was elected in the <a href="/wiki/12th_Lok_Sabha" title="12th Lok Sabha">12th Lok Sabha</a> elections from <a href="/wiki/Akola_(Lok_Sabha_constituency)" title="Akola (Lok Sabha constituency)">Akola Lok Sabha constituency</a> in 1998 as a candidate of the <a href="/wiki/Republican_Party_of_India" title="Republican Party of India">Republican Party of India</a>. Second time from the same constituency in 1999, he was elected as the Bharipa Bahujan Mahasangh's candidate for the <a href="/wiki/13th_Lok_Sabha" title="13th Lok Sabha">13th Lok Sabha</a> elections and he was a member of the <a href="/wiki/Lok_Sabha" title="Lok Sabha">Lok Sabha</a> till 2004.<sup id="cite_ref-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9">&#91;9&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-10" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-10">&#91;10&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-11" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-11">&#91;11&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-12" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-12">&#91;12&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Ambedkar followed a policy, on the one hand, of regrouping the Dalits, and on the other of following a moderate line seeking alliance with those opposition parties which sympathised with the Dalit cause. It was with their support that he twice contested elections to the parliament from non-reserved constituencies. Though not successful in getting elected, he polled a sizeable number of votes on both the occasions.<sup id="cite_ref-:0_13-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:0-13">&#91;13&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>The RPI organised a march from Nashik to Mumbai to press its demands, prominent among which was the transfer of <a href="/wiki/Vatandar" title="Vatandar">vatan lands</a> to their Dalit cultivators. (Both before and after the British Raj, certain lands were given to people for services rendered by them to the government or to the community or to both. These lands are also called "watan lands" in local legislation and in Maharashtra many of the watans were abolished between 1950 and 1960.)<sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">&#91;<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed"><span title="This claim needs references to reliable sources. (May 2019)">citation needed</span></a></i>&#93;</sup> In response, the government appointed a committee with Prakash Ambedkar as a member.<sup id="cite_ref-14" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-14">&#91;14&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>The RPI's greatest success was in 1988 when Ambedkar, in alliance with other Dalit organisations, took out a massive demonstration in Mumbai. The occasion was the controversy regarding a move to delete from the official publication of B. R. Ambedkar's writings a portion called <i>Riddles of Hinduism</i>. The deletion move was supported by <a href="/wiki/Shiv_Sena" title="Shiv Sena">Shiv Sena</a> which by this time was emerging as a Hindu political organisation. To bring all Dalit organisations together for this purpose, Prakash Ambedkar formed Ambedkar Vichar Samvardhak Samiti (AVSS).<sup id="cite_ref-:0_13-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:0-13">&#91;13&#93;</a></sup> Under the leadership of Prakash Ambedkar, <a href="/wiki/R._S._Gavai" title="R. S. Gavai">R. S. Gavai</a> and others on 5 February 1988, Dalits put on a massive show of strength which brought more than four to five <a href="/wiki/Lakh" title="Lakh">lakh</a> followers of <a href="/wiki/B._R._Ambedkar" title="B. R. Ambedkar">B. R. Ambedkar</a> into the heart of Mumbai city from different parts of Maharashtra and also from <a href="/wiki/Gujarat" title="Gujarat">Gujarat</a> and other states. Within days of the Dalit demonstration in Mumbai, the 'Riddles' issue was resolved at a meeting on February 10 of representatives of the <a href="/wiki/Shiv_Sena" title="Shiv Sena">Shiv Sena</a>, the Maratha Mahasangh and the various groups of the <a href="/wiki/Republican_Party_of_India" title="Republican Party of India">Republican Party of India</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Dalit_Panthers" title="Dalit Panthers">Dalit Panthers</a> called by the state chief minister. It was agreed at the meeting that the relevant appendix would be retained intact in the fourth volume of Ambedkar's works; only a line would be added to clarify that the Maharashtra government did not agree or disagree with B. R. Ambedkar's comments on the Hindu gods.<sup id="cite_ref-15" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-15">&#91;15&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Bahujan Mahasangh, a political formation working in close association with the Bharatiya Republican Party led by Prakash Ambedkar, was formed in February 1993. In the summer of that year, its candidate won Kinwat legislative assembly seat in Nanded district, defeating Congress and BJP contestants.<sup id="cite_ref-16" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-16">&#91;16&#93;</a></sup> The alliance between Bharatiya Republican Party and Bahujan Mahasangh visualised a joint front of Dalits and OBCs whose cultural identity was essentially non-Brahmin. Bahujan Mahasangh argued that in the Brahminical social order, both Dalits and OBCs find themselves equally oppressed culturally.<sup id="cite_ref-17" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-17">&#91;17&#93;</a></sup> Bahujan Mahasangh had defined the Bahujan category to include Buddhists, Sikhs, Jains and Muslims, as well as caste groups such as Shudra (OBCs) and ati-Shudra (Dalits), tribes, women, poor Marathas, and poor Brahmins, thus including all those who are subjugated through caste, class and gender exploitation.<sup id="cite_ref-18" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-18">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In memory of <a href="/wiki/Mahar" title="Mahar">Mahar</a> soldiers who fought in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Koregaon" title="Battle of Koregaon">Battle of Koregaon</a>, their descendants (<a href="/wiki/Marathi_Buddhists" title="Marathi Buddhists">Buddhists</a>) visit <a href="/wiki/Koregaon_Bhima" title="Koregaon Bhima">Koregaon Bhima</a> on 1 January every year to honor them. On 1 January 2018, <a href="/wiki/Marathi_Buddhists" title="Marathi Buddhists">Buddhists</a>, as well as some <a href="/wiki/Hindu" class="mw-redirect" title="Hindu">Hindu</a> dalit, OBC and <a href="/wiki/Sikh" class="mw-redirect" title="Sikh">Sikh</a> people visited the 'Jay sthambh' (victory pillar) at <a href="/wiki/Koregaon_Bhima" title="Koregaon Bhima">Koregaon Bhima</a> in <a href="/wiki/Pune_district" title="Pune district">Pune district</a>, <a href="/wiki/Maharashtra" title="Maharashtra">Maharashtra</a>.Prakash Ambedkar accused <a href="/wiki/Sambhaji_Bhide" title="Sambhaji Bhide">Sambhaji Bhide</a> and <a href="/wiki/Milind_Ekbote" title="Milind Ekbote">Milind Ekbote</a> of seducing the invading Hindutva people and demanded the police investigation and strict action against the two. But the Maharashtra government and the state police did not take any action against the culprits. So on 3 January 2018, he called on the people of Maharashtra to call "Maharashtra <a href="/wiki/Bandh" title="Bandh">Bandh</a>". This call to shut down Maharashtra received a huge response from the people and the <a href="/wiki/Bandh" title="Bandh">bandh</a> was a success. The bandh was seen across Maharashtra including <a href="/wiki/Mumbai" title="Mumbai">Mumbai</a>. According to Ambedkar, more than 50% Maharashtrian people participated in the bandh. Earlier only <a href="/wiki/Bal_Thackeray" title="Bal Thackeray">Bal Thackeray</a> of Shiv Sena had the power to shut down Mumbai. Subsequently, Prakash Ambedkar's political power increased. He came to the center of Ambedkarite and Bahujan community. The youth group in particular became his supporters.<sup id="cite_ref-19" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-19">&#91;19&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-20" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20">&#91;20&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-21" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-21">&#91;21&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-22" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-22">&#91;22&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-23" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-23">&#91;23&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-24" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-24">&#91;24&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-25" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-25">&#91;25&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Prakash Ambedkar founded new political party the <i><a href="/wiki/Vanchit_Bahujan_Aghadi" class="mw-redirect" title="Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi">Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi</a></i> on 20 March 2018 with its ideology primarily emphasizing <a href="/wiki/Constitutionalism" title="Constitutionalism">Constitutionalism</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ambedkarism" class="mw-redirect" title="Ambedkarism">Ambedkarism</a>, <a href="/wiki/Secularism" title="Secularism">Secularism</a>, <a href="/wiki/Socialism" title="Socialism">Socialism</a> and <a href="/wiki/Progressivism" title="Progressivism">Progressivism</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-26" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-26">&#91;26&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-27" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-27">&#91;27&#93;</a></sup> The Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi registered as a political party a year later on 15 March 2019, prior to the <a href="/wiki/2019_Indian_general_election" title="2019 Indian general election">2019 elections</a> for <a href="/wiki/Lok_Sabha" title="Lok Sabha">Lok Sabha</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-28" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-28">&#91;28&#93;</a></sup> It is supported by nearly 100 small political parties and social organizations.<sup id="cite_ref-29" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-29">&#91;29&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-30" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-30">&#91;30&#93;</a></sup> Prakash Ambedkar is the supremo of the Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi.<sup id="cite_ref-31" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-31">&#91;31&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 14 March 2019, Ambedkar has announced the Bharipa Bahujan Mahasangh will merge with the Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi. He said that, despite the 'Akola pattern' of social engineering through the success of the Bharipa-Bahujan Mahasangh, the word 'Bharipa' (RPI) had limited the expansion of the party. He said that after the 2019 Lok Sabha elections, the Bharip-Bahujan Mahasangh will merge with the Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi, because the Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi is acceptable in a broad sense.<sup id="cite_ref-32" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-32">&#91;32&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-33" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-33">&#91;33&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-34" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-34">&#91;34&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-35" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-35">&#91;35&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Ambedkar contested and lost from both <a href="/wiki/Akola_(Lok_Sabha_constituency)" title="Akola (Lok Sabha constituency)">Akola</a> and <a href="/wiki/Solapur_(Lok_Sabha_constituency)" title="Solapur (Lok Sabha constituency)">Solapur</a> in the 2019 Lok Sabha elections.<sup id="cite_ref-36" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-36">&#91;36&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-37" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-37">&#91;37&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Controversy">Controversy</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Prakash_Yashwant_Ambedkar&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" title="Edit section: Controversy">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>Prakash Ambedkar courted controversy by asking his supporters to resort to troll against those who criticised his statement asking for proof on surgical strikes conducted by <a href="/wiki/Indian_Air_Force" title="Indian Air Force">Indian Air Force</a>. Many critics called it militant Dalit politics.<sup id="cite_ref-38" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-38">&#91;38&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-39" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-39">&#91;39&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Writings">Writings</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Prakash_Yashwant_Ambedkar&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" title="Edit section: Writings">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<ul><li><i>Ambedkari Chalval Sampli Ahe</i> (The Ambedkarite Movement Has Ended)<sup id="cite_ref-40" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-40">&#91;40&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><i>Andheri Nagari Chaupat Raja</i></li>
<li><i>Maharashtracha Uddyacha Mukhyamantri Varkari ani Varkarich</i></li>
<li><i>Can It Be Stopped!</i><sup id="cite_ref-41" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-41">&#91;41&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Rashtriya_Swayamsevak_Sangh" title="Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh">Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh</a> Cha Vaicharik Bhrashtachar</i> (Ideological Corruption of the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh)<sup id="cite_ref-42" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-42">&#91;42&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li><i>Aetehasik Ambedkar Bhawanacha Varasa Aapan Japanar Ki Nahi&#160;?</i> (The Historic Heritage Of Ambedkar Bhavan Will We Preserve It?)<sup id="cite_ref-43" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-43">&#91;43&#93;</a></sup></li></ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Positions_held">Positions held</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Prakash_Yashwant_Ambedkar&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6" title="Edit section: Positions held">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>Ambedkar has held following positions,<sup id="cite_ref-44" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-44">&#91;44&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<ul><li>1990-96: Nominated Member, <a href="/wiki/Rajya_Sabha" title="Rajya Sabha">Rajya Sabha</a> from 18 September 1990 to 17 September 1996.<sup id="cite_ref-rajyasabha1_7-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-rajyasabha1-7">&#91;7&#93;</a></sup></li>
<li>1992-96: Member, Committee on Rules</li>
<li>1993-96: Member, Committee on Communications</li>
<li>1998-99: Elected to 12th <a href="/wiki/Lok_Sabha" title="Lok Sabha">Lok Sabha</a>, (1st term) Leader, <a href="/wiki/Republican_Party_of_India" title="Republican Party of India">Republican Party of India</a> Parliamentary Party</li>
<li>1998-99: Member, Committee on Food, Civil Supplies and Public Distribution; Member, Consultative Committee, Ministry of Human Resource Development</li>
<li>1999–2004: Re-elected to 13th <a href="/wiki/Lok_Sabha" title="Lok Sabha">Lok Sabha</a> (2nd term); Leader, <a href="/wiki/Bharipa_Bahujan_Mahasangh" title="Bharipa Bahujan Mahasangh">Bharipa Bahujan Mahasangh</a> Parliamentary Party, <a href="/wiki/Lok_Sabha" title="Lok Sabha">Lok Sabha</a></li>
<li>1999-2000: Member, Committee on Energy</li>
<li>2000–2004: Member, Consultative Committee, Ministry of Railways</li></ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="See_also">See also</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Prakash_Yashwant_Ambedkar&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7" title="Edit section: See also">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/List_of_Rajya_Sabha_members_from_Maharashtra" title="List of Rajya Sabha members from Maharashtra">List of Rajya Sabha members from Maharashtra</a></li></ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Prakash_Yashwant_Ambedkar&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8" title="Edit section: References">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>

</li>
<li id="cite_note-rajyasabha1-7"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-rajyasabha1_7-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-rajyasabha1_7-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://rajyasabha.nic.in/rsnew/pre_member/1952_2003/a.pdf">"Microsoft Word - biograp_sketc_1a.htm"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span><span class="reference-accessdate">. </li>
<li id="cite_note-8"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-8">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://164.100.47.5/Newmembers/alphabeticallist_all_terms.aspx">"Alphabetical List Of Former Members Of Rajya Sabha Since 1952"</a>. <li id="cite_note-21"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-21">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFकोन्नुर2018" class="citation web cs1">कोन्नुर, मयूरेश (3 January 2018). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.bbc.com/hindi/india-42540567">"कोरेगांव हिंसा: दलित संगठनों का आज महाराष्ट्र बंद"</a> &#8211; via www.bbc.com.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=%E0%A4%95%E0%A5%8B%E0%A4%B0%E0%A5%87%E0%A4%97%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%82%E0%A4%B5+%E0%A4%B9%E0%A4%BF%E0%A4%82%E0%A4%B8%E0%A4%BE%3A+%E0%A4%A6%E0%A4%B2%E0%A4%BF%E0%A4%A4+%E0%A4%B8%E0%A4%82%E0%A4%97%E0%A4%A0%E0%A4%A8%E0%A5%8B%E0%A4%82+%E0%A4%95%E0%A4%BE+%E0%A4%86%E0%A4%9C+%E0%A4%AE%E0%A4%B9%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%B0%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%B7%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%9F%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%B0+%E0%A4%AC%E0%A4%82%E0%A4%A6&amp;rft.date=2018-01-03&amp;rft.aulast=%E0%A4%95%E0%A5%8B%E0%A4%A8%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%A8%E0%A5%81%E0%A4%B0&amp;rft.aufirst=%E0%A4%AE%E0%A4%AF%E0%A5%82%E0%A4%B0%E0%A5%87%E0%A4%B6&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bbc.com%2Fhindi%2Findia-42540567&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3APrakash+Yashwant+Ambedkar" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r982806391"/></span>

<li id="cite_note-22"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-22">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://thewirehindi.com/30471/bhima-koregaon-violence-maharashtra-bandh/">"महाराष्ट्र बंद: मुंबई में बसों पर हमला, नागपुर और पुणे में स्थिति तनावपूर्ण"</a>. <i>thewirehindi.com</i>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=thewirehindi.com&amp;rft.atitle=%E0%A4%AE%E0%A4%B9%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%B0%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%B7%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%9F%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%B0+%E0%A4%AC%E0%A4%82%E0%A4%A6%3A+%E0%A4%AE%E0%A5%81%E0%A4%82%E0%A4%AC%E0%A4%88+%E0%A4%AE%E0%A5%87%E0%A4%82+%E0%A4%AC%E0%A4%B8%E0%A5%8B%E0%A4%82+%E0%A4%AA%E0%A4%B0+%E0%A4%B9%E0%A4%AE%E0%A4%B2%E0%A4%BE%2C+%E0%A4%A8%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%97%E0%A4%AA%E0%A5%81%E0%A4%B0+%E0%A4%94%E0%A4%B0+%E0%A4%AA%E0%A5%81%E0%A4%A3%E0%A5%87+%E0%A4%AE%E0%A5%87%E0%A4%82+%E0%A4%B8%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%A5%E0%A4%BF%E0%A4%A4%E0%A4%BF+%E0%A4%A4%E0%A4%A8%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%B5%E0%A4%AA%E0%A5%82%E0%A4%B0%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%A3&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fthewirehindi.com%2F30471%2Fbhima-koregaon-violence-maharashtra-bandh%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3APrakash+Yashwant+Ambedkar" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r982806391"/></span>

<li id="cite_note-23"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-23">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFTripathi2018" class="citation web cs1">Tripathi, Avinash (27 March 2018). <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" को अल्टीमेटम- भीमा-कोरेगांव हिंसा के मुख्य आरोपी संभाजी भिड़े को आठ दिन में करें गिरफ्तार"</a>. <i>India TV Hindi</i>.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=India+TV+Hindi&amp;rft.atitle=%E0%A4%AE%E0%A4%B9%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%B0%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%B7%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%9F%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%B0%3A+%E0%A4%AA%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%B0%E0%A4%95%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%B6+%E0%A4%85%E0%A4%82%E0%A4%AC%E0%A5%87%E0%A4%A1%E0%A4%95%E0%A4%B0+%E0%A4%A8%E0%A5%87+%E0%A4%A6%E0%A4%BF%E0%A4%AF%E0%A4%BE+%E0%A4%AC%E0%A5%80%E0%A4%9C%E0%A5%87%E0%A4%AA%E0%A5%80+%E0%A4%95%E0%A5%8B+%E0%A4%85%E0%A4%B2%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%9F%E0%A5%80%E0%A4%AE%E0%A5%87%E0%A4%9F%E0%A4%AE-+%E0%A4%AD%E0%A5%80%E0%A4%AE%E0%A4%BE-%E0%A4%95%E0%A5%8B%E0%A4%B0%E0%A5%87%E0%A4%97%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%82%E0%A4%B5+%E0%A4%B9%E0%A4%BF%E0%A4%82%E0%A4%B8%E0%A4%BE+%E0%A4%95%E0%A5%87+%E0%A4%AE%E0%A5%81%E0%A4%96%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%AF+%E0%A4%86%E0%A4%B0%E0%A5%8B%E0%A4%AA%E0%A5%80+%E0%A4%B8%E0%A4%82%E0%A4%AD%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%9C%E0%A5%80+%E0%A4%AD%E0%A4%BF%E0%A4%A1%E0%A4%BC%E0%A5%87+%E0%A4%95%E0%A5%8B+%E0%A4%86%E0%A4%A0+%E0%A4%A6%E0%A4%BF%E0%A4%A8+%E0%A4%AE%E0%A5%87%E0%A4%82+%E0%A4%95%E0%A4%B0%E0%A5%87%E0%A4%82+%E0%A4%97%E0%A4%BF%E0%A4%B0%E0%A4%AB%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%A4%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%B0&amp;rft.date=2018-03-27&amp;rft.aulast=Tripathi&amp;rft.aufirst=Avinash&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fhindi.indiatvnews.com%2Findia%2Fnational-prakash-ambedkar-give-ultimatum-to-maharashtra-bjp-government-arrest-sambhaji-bhide-in-eight-days-574885&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3APrakash+Yashwant+Ambedkar" <li id="cite_note-40"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-40">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://maharashtradesha.com/prakash-ambedkar-comment-on-congress-nap/">"वंचितवर पराभवाचे खापर फोडणारे आघाडीचे नेते आंबेडकरांच्या 'या' प्रश्नांची उत्तरं देतील का&#160;?"</a>. 31 October 2019.</cite><span title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=%E0%A4%B5%E0%A4%82%E0%A4%9A%E0%A4%BF%E0%A4%A4%E0%A4%B5%E0%A4%B0+%E0%A4%AA%E0%A4%B0%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%AD%E0%A4%B5%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%9A%E0%A5%87+%E0%A4%96%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%AA%E0%A4%B0+%E0%A4%AB%E0%A5%8B%E0%A4%A1%E0%A4%A3%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%B0%E0%A5%87+%E0%A4%86%E0%A4%98%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%A1%E0%A5%80%E0%A4%9A%E0%A5%87+%E0%A4%A8%E0%A5%87%E0%A4%A4%E0%A5%87+%E0%A4%86%E0%A4%82%E0%A4%AC%E0%A5%87%E0%A4%A1%E0%A4%95%E0%A4%B0%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%82%E0%A4%9A%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%AF%E0%A4%BE+%27%E0%A4%AF%E0%A4%BE%27+%E0%A4%AA%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%B0%E0%A4%B6%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%A8%E0%A4%BE%E0%A4%82%E0%A4%9A%E0%A5%80+%E0%A4%89%E0%A4%A4%E0%A5%8D%E0%A4%A4%E0%A4%B0%E0%A4%82+%E0%A4%A6%E0%A5%87%E0%A4%A4%E0%A5%80%E0%A4%B2+%E0%A4%95%E0%A4%BE+%3F&amp;rft.date=2019-10-31&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fmaharashtradesha.com%2Fprakash-ambedkar-comment-on-congress-nap%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3APrakash+Yashwant+Ambedkar" class="Z3988"></span><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r982806391"/></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-41"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-41">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREFAmbedkar2014" class="citation book cs1">Ambedkar, Prakash (2014). <i>Can It Be Stopped!</i> (1st ed.). <li id="cite_note-42"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-42">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite id="CITEREF????????2013" class="citation book cs1">????????,&#160;?????? <li id="cite_note-43"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-43">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><cite class="citation web cs1"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.bookganga.com/eBooks/Books?AID=4875722349489549077">"BookGanga - Creation | Publication | Distribution"</a>. <i>www.bookganga.com</i><span class="reference-accessdate">. <table class="infobox vcard" style="width:22em"><caption class="fn org">American Educational Research Association</caption><tbody><tr><th scope="row" style="padding-right:0.6em;">Formation</th><td class="note">1916<span class="noprint">&#59;&#32;104&#160;years ago</span><span style="display:none">&#160;(<span class="bday dtstart published updated">1916</span>)</span></td></tr><tr><th scope="row" style="padding-right:0.6em;">Headquarters</th><td><a href="/wiki/1430_K_Street" title="1430 K Street">1430 K Street</a> <br /><a href="/wiki/Washington,_D.C." title="Washington, D.C.">Washington, D.C.</a>, <a href="/wiki/United_States" title="United States">U.S.</a></td></tr><tr><th scope="row" style="padding-right:0.6em;"><div style="display:inline-block; padding:0.1em 0;line-height:1.2em;">Membership  </div></th><td>25000 members</td></tr><tr><th scope="row" style="padding-right:0.6em;"><div style="display:inline-block; padding:0.1em 0;line-height:1.2em;">2019-20 President</div></th><td>Vanessa Siddle-Walker<sup id="cite_ref-About-AERA_Leadership_1-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-About-AERA_Leadership-1">&#91;1&#93;</a></sup></td></tr><tr><th scope="row" style="padding-right:0.6em;"><div style="display:inline-block; padding:0.1em 0;line-height:1.2em;">Executive Director</div></th><td>Felice J. Levine</td></tr><tr><th scope="row" style="padding-right:0.6em;">Website</th><td><span class="url"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.aera.net">www<wbr />.aera<wbr />.net</a></span></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p>The <b>American Educational Research Association</b>, or <b>AERA</b> ("A-E-R-A"), is a professional organization representing education researchers in the <a href="/wiki/United_States" title="United States">United States</a> and around the <a href="/wiki/World" title="World">world</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-About-AERA_2-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-About-AERA-2">&#91;2&#93;</a></sup> As a nonprofit serving the education research field, AERA strives to advance knowledge about education and promote the use of research in practice.<sup id="cite_ref-About-AERA_2-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-About-AERA-2">&#91;2&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div id="toc" class="toc" role="navigation" aria-labelledby="mw-toc-heading"><input type="checkbox" role="button" id="toctogglecheckbox" class="toctogglecheckbox" style="display:none" /><div class="toctitle" lang="en" dir="ltr"><h2 id="mw-toc-heading">Contents</h2><span class="toctogglespan"><label class="toctogglelabel" for="toctogglecheckbox"></label></span></div>

</div>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Organization_and_membership">Organization and membership</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=American_Educational_Research_Association&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" title="Edit section: Organization and membership">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>AERA is led by an Executive Director (Felice J. Levine in 2020) and a President (<a href="/wiki/Vanessa_Siddle_Walker" title="Vanessa Siddle Walker">Vanessa Siddle-Walker</a> from <a href="/wiki/Emory_University" title="Emory University">Emory University</a> in 2019-20).<sup id="cite_ref-About-AERA_Leadership_1-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-About-AERA_Leadership-1">&#91;1&#93;</a></sup> AERA's governance structure includes the Council, Executive Board, standing committees, and award committees.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3">&#91;3&#93;</a></sup> Temporary committees, task forces, and working groups are initiated for other specific needs.
</p><p>AERA has 25,000 members, including scientists, teachers, students, <a href="/wiki/Administration_(business)" class="mw-redirect" title="Administration (business)">administrators</a>, <a href="/wiki/State_education_agency" title="State education agency">state</a> and local agencies, <a href="/wiki/School_counselor" title="School counselor">counselors</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Evaluator" class="mw-redirect" title="Evaluator">evaluators</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4">&#91;4&#93;</a></sup> The broad range of disciplines represented by the membership includes education, psychology, statistics, sociology, history, economics, philosophy, anthropology, and political science. There are 12 divisions covering different research areas in education.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Early_history">Early history</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=American_Educational_Research_Association&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" title="Edit section: Early history">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>AERA (known originally as National Association of Directors of Educational Research) was founded in 1916 as an interest group within the <a href="/wiki/National_Education_Association" title="National Education Association">National Education Association</a> Department of Superintendence. The association's eight founders - Burdette R. Buckingham, Albert Shiels, Leonard P. Ayres, Frank W. Ballou, Stuart A. Courtis, Edwin Hebden, George Melcher, and Joseph P. O’Hern – were all directors of education research in various parts of the United States. They met at the 1915 NEA Department of Superintendence annual meeting and came to the idea of starting an organization to advance education research. Their constitution was approved the following year, committing the association to improving public education.
</p><p>Early topics of interest for early AERA included research bureau operations, measurement techniques, and particular school situations. Active membership in the early association was reserved for research bureau directors and their assistants. The association's early years revolved around the annual convention. Between meetings, the association published an internal quarterly newsletter, the Educational Research Bulletin.
</p><p>By the end of the <a href="/wiki/World_War_I" title="World War I">World War I</a> in 1918, the association had 36 active members and four honorary members and was affecting public policy, visible in the school districts that started to change student coursework and education practices as a result of standardized tests. Mental testing developments, primarily <a href="/wiki/Psychometrics" title="Psychometrics">psychometrics</a> as a result of the First World War, new subfields of education, and the growth of education research at the post-secondary level challenged the association to widen its mission. The association opened its membership to include anyone who could demonstrate their competence as a researcher indicated by their published or unpublished work. In 1922, members voted to adopt a name that represented their goal of representing the interests of all American education researchers – Educational Research Association of America. Over the years that followed, membership saw a dramatic increase, particularly among university personal, which grew from 48% to 69% between 1923 and 1927.
</p><p>The association's original publication, the Journal of Educational Research, began in 1919.
</p><p>The ability of education research to provide guidance for education practitioners was a struggle throughout the association's beginnings, with only ambiguous known relationships between testing and learning outcomes. The association recognized the need to establish theoretical foundations for the field of education research. In 1928, the association changed its name to the American Educational Research Association, as it is currently known.
</p><p>During the Great Depression, the association's public school affiliates struggled with tight finances and uncertain employment, but during the same time, university education researchers dominated the field and emerged as a unique social entity. Also during this time, AERA officials grew their relationships with like-minded associations, and a new journal, the <a href="/wiki/Review_of_Educational_Research" title="Review of Educational Research">Review of Educational Research</a>, began as a reference work, summarizing recent studies. While early topics in <a href="/wiki/Review_of_Educational_Research" title="Review of Educational Research">Review of Educational Research</a> focused primarily on education psychology and administration, the publication broadened its coverage in the mid-1930s in response to diversification in the field.
</p><p>The role of education research in the <a href="/wiki/Progressive_education" title="Progressive education">progressive education</a> movement was a source of contention between education researchers, some of whom felt that it should play an active role in policy issues, and others who felt that it should be used primarily for professional discourse. As the field continued to advance, much of the knowledge did not translate into practice, an issue that is still widely debated today. These divisions in the field made it difficult for education researchers to speak with one voice. Just prior to World War II, <a href="/wiki/Review_of_Educational_Research" title="Review of Educational Research">Review of Educational Research</a> made the case that because science could not speak to goals and choices, education research should contribute as one source of many to shaping American education.<sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5">&#91;5&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Publications">Publications</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=American_Educational_Research_Association&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" title="Edit section: Publications">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>The Areas publishes books, reports and journals.<sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-6">&#91;6&#93;</a></sup> AERA publishes seven peer-reviewed journals:<sup id="cite_ref-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-7">&#91;7&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<ul><li><i> AERA Open</i></li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/American_Educational_Research_Journal" title="American Educational Research Journal">American Educational Research Journal</a></i></li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Educational_Evaluation_and_Policy_Analysis" title="Educational Evaluation and Policy Analysis">Educational Evaluation and Policy Analysis</a></i></li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Educational_Researcher_(journal)" class="mw-redirect" title="Educational Researcher (journal)">Educational Researcher</a></i></li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Journal_of_Educational_and_Behavioral_Statistics" title="Journal of Educational and Behavioral Statistics">Journal of Educational and Behavioral Statistics</a></i> (published jointly with the <a href="/wiki/American_Statistical_Association" title="American Statistical Association">American Statistical Association</a>)</li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Review_of_Educational_Research" title="Review of Educational Research">Review of Educational Research</a></i></li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Review_of_Research_in_Education" title="Review of Research in Education">Review of Research in Education</a></i></li></ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Events">Events</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=American_Educational_Research_Association&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" title="Edit section: Events">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>AERA's Annual Meeting held every spring is the largest gathering of scholars in the education research field with approximately 14,000 participants. The five-day conference is a showcase of research studies across education disciplines at all levels.
</p><p>AERA also hosts the annual <i>Brown</i> Lecture in Education Research, which highlights the role of research in advancing equality in education. The first <i>Brown</i> Lecture was held in 2004 to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the <i>Brown v. Board of Education</i> decision.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Education_research_and_policy">Education research and policy</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=American_Educational_Research_Association&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" title="Edit section: Education research and policy">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>AERA is expanding the availability of their resources by participating in the <a href="/wiki/Open_access" title="Open access">open access</a> movement. AERA currently offers <a href="/wiki/Educational_Researcher_(journal)" class="mw-redirect" title="Educational Researcher (journal)">Educational Researcher (journal)</a> <a href="/wiki/Open_access" title="Open access">open access</a>, as well as an Online Paper Repository containing presentations from the 2010 Annual Meeting forward. An <a href="/wiki/Open_access" title="Open access">open access</a>, peer-reviewed journal – AERA Open – launched in 2014.
</p><p>On the policy front, AERA is actively involved in revisions to the <a href="/wiki/Common_rule" class="mw-redirect" title="Common rule">common rule</a>. Executive Director Felice J. Levine served on the <a href="/wiki/National_Research_Council_(United_States)" class="mw-redirect" title="National Research Council (United States)">National Research Council</a> committee charged with reviewing proposed regulations. The committee published its report in early 2014.<sup id="cite_ref-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-8">&#91;8&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>AERA helps lead an ongoing initiative as part of the social science research community to increase federal funding for education research, particularly research in the social and behavioral sciences.
</p><p>In addition, AERA is active in the reauthorization of the <a href="/wiki/Institute_of_Education_Sciences" title="Institute of Education Sciences">Institute of Education Sciences</a> bill – Strengthening Education through Research Act – which was advanced by the <a href="/wiki/United_States_House_Committee_on_Education_and_the_Workforce" class="mw-redirect" title="United States House Committee on Education and the Workforce">United States House Committee on Education and the Workforce</a> in April 2014.<sup id="cite_ref-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9">&#91;9&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Education_research_initiatives">Education research initiatives</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=American_Educational_Research_Association&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6" title="Edit section: Education research initiatives">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>AERA is involved in several education research initiatives, ranging from specific advocacy topics to supporting projects that serve the larger community. AERA supports the Education Research Conferences Program, which awards grants for conferences on ground-breaking topics. AERA's Education Research Service Projects is designed to encourage researchers to offer their expertise to organizations and groups who may have a need but not the funds to engage their assistance.
</p><p>One topic area that AERA has been immensely involved is affirmative action. In 2013, AERA presented an amicus brief on the importance of science in a major affirmative action case – <i>Fisher v. University of Texas at Austin</i>.<sup id="cite_ref-10" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-10">&#91;10&#93;</a></sup>
AERA also presented an amicus brief on <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=B16LDwrtlgU">affirmative action</a> in December 2015.
</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="External_links">External links</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=American_Educational_Research_Association&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8" title="Edit section: External links">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<ul><li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="http://www.aera.net/">American Educational Research Association</a></li></ul></div>
~~~~
<table class="box-Peacock plainlinks metadata ambox ambox-content ambox-peacock" role="presentation"><tbody><tr><td class="mbox-image"><div style="width:52px"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/40px-Ambox_important.svg.png" decoding="async" width="40" height="40" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/60px-Ambox_important.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/b4/Ambox_important.svg/80px-Ambox_important.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="40" data-file-height="40" /></div></td><td class="mbox-text"><div class="mbox-text-span">This article contains wording that <b><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Manual_of_Style/Words_to_watch#Puffery" title="Wikipedia:Manual of Style/Words to watch">promotes the subject in a subjective manner</a> without imparting real information</b>.<span class="hide-when-compact"> Please remove or replace such wording and instead of making proclamations about a subject's importance, use facts and attribution to demonstrate that importance.</span>  <small class="date-container"><i>(<span class="date">November 2017</span>)</i></small><small class="hide-when-compact"><i> (<a href="/wiki/Help:Maintenance_template_removal" title="Help:Maintenance template removal">Learn how and when to remove this template message</a>)</i></small></div></td></tr></tbody></table>
<table class="infobox biography vcard" style="width:22em"><tbody><tr><th colspan="2" style="text-align:center;font-size:125%;font-weight:bold"><div class="fn" style="display:inline">Ravindra Amonkar</div></th></tr><tr><th scope="row">Born</th><td>1950 (age&#160;69&#8211;70)<br /><div style="display:inline" class="birthplace"><a href="/wiki/Goa" title="Goa">Goa</a>, India</div></td></tr><tr><th scope="row">Occupation</th><td class="role">Theatre director</td></tr></tbody></table>
<p><b>Ravindra Amonkar</b>  is a Goan theatre artist and director and also a previous vice-chairman <sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1">&#91;1&#93;</a></sup> of Bal Bhavan Goa.He mastered the areas of dramatics and theatre art such as acting, set designing, light arrangements, sound editing, choreography, script writing, translations, background &amp; main music direction, art direction, and production. He proved his talent through successful &amp; prize-winning performance in competitions within and outside the state.
</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Early_life">Early life</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Ravindra_Amonkar&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" title="Edit section: Early life">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>At the age of 20, he founded and established renowned organizations/production houses like Navrang Stars and Vakratund and pioneered children’s stage movement (Baalnatya Chalval <sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2">&#91;2&#93;</a></sup>) in Goa. Through these organizations, he provided stage, training, and opportunity to over 3000 artists across Goa and bagged several awards at the State and National level. He has staged nearly 175 one-act plays as an artist, directed over 80 dramas across the State of Goa. He has the credit of making Goa’s first <i>Maha Natya</i> (Mega Drama with nearly 75 artists) by the name Mohammad Tughlaq. He has worked with scripts in Marathi, Konkani, Hindi, and English. He has also learned Sanskrit during his role of Rajshekhar in Sultan – a short play for an inter-college competition and received a gold medal for the same.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Career">Career</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Ravindra_Amonkar&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" title="Edit section: Career">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>In his diversified contribution and participation in theatre, he has also worked &amp; directed Sangeet Natak (Musical Drama). He has extensively promoted children’s theatre in Goa and taken it to new heights as Vice Chairperson of Bal Bhavan.<sup id="cite_ref-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-3">&#91;3&#93;</a></sup> He has guided almost every experimental &amp; prominent festive stage and has his own production team. In the capacity of Vice Chairperson Bal Bhavan within a period of 5 years, he has guided over 5000 children in various facets and skills required for the stage. From school level to Higher Secondary level he's organised workshops, competitions,<sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4">&#91;4&#93;</a></sup> taught them acting in telefilms specially meant for children and has decided to contribute the rest of his life for creating a conducive environment for budding artists of Goa.<sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5">&#91;5&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span id="Goa.27s_traditional_arts"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Goa's_traditional_arts">Goa's traditional arts</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Ravindra_Amonkar&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3" title="Edit section: Goa&#039;s traditional arts">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>Shri. Ravindra Amonkar is closely associated with the festive traditional theatre in Goa which is spread throughout Goa and has contributed at all levels including directing budding youngsters and the professional actors are groomed under him. He has also taken the traditional stage to the National level and hence was able to grab prominent positions on executive and general body committee of Kala Academy, <a href="/wiki/Akhil_Bharatiya_Marathi_Natya_Parishad" title="Akhil Bharatiya Marathi Natya Parishad">Akhil Bharatiya Marathi Natya Parishad</a>, Akhil Govmantak Marathi Natya Maha Sangh, Goa College of Music, West Zone Culture (Udaipur), Sahitya Sevak Mandal, Saraswati Mandir, Directorate of Art &amp; Culture, Government of Goa.<sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-6">&#91;6&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Ravindra_Amonkar_Bal_Bhavan_02.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2f/Ravindra_Amonkar_Bal_Bhavan_02.jpg/220px-Ravindra_Amonkar_Bal_Bhavan_02.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="110" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2f/Ravindra_Amonkar_Bal_Bhavan_02.jpg/330px-Ravindra_Amonkar_Bal_Bhavan_02.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/2f/Ravindra_Amonkar_Bal_Bhavan_02.jpg/440px-Ravindra_Amonkar_Bal_Bhavan_02.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1189" data-file-height="595" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Ravindra_Amonkar_Bal_Bhavan_02.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Ravindra Amonkar Bal Bhavan</div></div></div>
<p>The theme of his life has been to enrich the cultural heritage of Goa, by inculcating love &amp; passion for creative art in the field of drama &amp; confidence for stage performance amongst all the age groups by imparting professional training, handholding and setting an example by giving performances at state and national level.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Performance">Performance</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Ravindra_Amonkar&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4" title="Edit section: Performance">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Ravindra_Amonkar_Bal_Bhavan.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1f/Ravindra_Amonkar_Bal_Bhavan.jpg/220px-Ravindra_Amonkar_Bal_Bhavan.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="141" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1f/Ravindra_Amonkar_Bal_Bhavan.jpg/330px-Ravindra_Amonkar_Bal_Bhavan.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1f/Ravindra_Amonkar_Bal_Bhavan.jpg/440px-Ravindra_Amonkar_Bal_Bhavan.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1109" data-file-height="709" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Ravindra_Amonkar_Bal_Bhavan.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Ravindra Amonkar Bal Bhavan</div></div></div>
<p>His multi-disciplinary talent in the field of theatre includes his creative and outstanding acting skills, wonderful light arrangement on the stage, appropriately perfect background music, admirable set making, and brilliant direction resulting in excellent Productions.<sup id="cite_ref-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-7">&#91;7&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Cultural_work">Cultural work</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Ravindra_Amonkar&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5" title="Edit section: Cultural work">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<ul><li>Translated and directed over 20 Marathi and Hindi dramas scripts in Konkani.</li>
<li>Continues to create awareness at all levels on all forums especially ranging from young kids to eldest performing stage artists. Loves being amongst young children.</li>
<li>He has many record-breaking achievements by way of numerous awards, trophies, medals, and certificates which are a testimony of his achievements. Few to name are Stage Performances such as "Guru" in Pune, "Sabhyagruhastha ho" in Mumbai, "Columbus Vaat Chukla" in Delhi, "Hands up" in Mumbai, "He Bandh Reshmache" in Sangli, "Tughlaq" in Goa, etc.</li>
<li>His famous commercial productions on stage received immense acclamation and applause namely "Kartolo toh Bhogtolo" was staged by famous Artist Shri. Macchindra Kambli’s Bhardrakali Productions in the year 1989-90 and "Good Bye Doctor" are prominent productions.</li>
<li>He has been a successful producer and director of four unique telefilms namely "Mrutunjay" (2007–08), "Pragatiche Pankh De Chimanpakhara" (2005–06), "Salucho Kalu" (2008–09) and "Aayz Havv Channe Nhalo" (2009-10) in coordination with Goa Doordarshan. The children of Bal Bhavan below 16, were the only participants in the above mentioned last three telefilms</li>
<li>He has been taking a keen interest in theatre development and its progressive movement in rural areas too. Hundreds of artists have taken the privilege of his theatre experience while receiving training under him. He aims to build a strong foundation of young artists and thus still conducts workshops and directs one-act plays at school and college level. Till date, more than 3000 theatre artists have been trained under the able direction of Shri. Ravindra Amonkar</li></ul>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Government">Government</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Ravindra_Amonkar&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6" title="Edit section: Government">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Ravindra_Amonkar_Manohar_Parrikar.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/18/Ravindra_Amonkar_Manohar_Parrikar.jpg/220px-Ravindra_Amonkar_Manohar_Parrikar.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="176" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/18/Ravindra_Amonkar_Manohar_Parrikar.jpg/330px-Ravindra_Amonkar_Manohar_Parrikar.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/18/Ravindra_Amonkar_Manohar_Parrikar.jpg/440px-Ravindra_Amonkar_Manohar_Parrikar.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1242" data-file-height="996" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Ravindra_Amonkar_Manohar_Parrikar.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Ravindra Amonkar with Manohar Parrikar</div></div></div>
<ul><li>Served as a member of Executive in Kala Academy — Goa.</li>
<li>Served as a member of the General board in Kala Academy — Goa.</li>
<li>Served as Chairman of State Cultural Awards selection Committee of Department of Arts and Culture — Government of Goa.</li>
<li>Esteemed member of judgement team for State level competition in Goa &amp; also judged competitions in Maharashtra State and Delhi.</li>
<li>Served as a resource person on almost all the forums related to theatre in Goa.</li>
<li>Presently serving as Vice Chairman of Bal Bhavan — Goa.</li></ul>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Awards">Awards</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Ravindra_Amonkar&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7" title="Edit section: Awards">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<ul><li>Honoured with Goa State Cultural Award in the field of theatre.</li>
<li>Recipient of <i>Rangosonmon</i> Award of Kala Academy.</li>
<li>Recipient of Kala Sanrnan Award by Directorate of Arts &amp; Culture.</li>
<li>Was a pioneer in bagging first-time awards as best actor, director in Maharashtra (Pune, Mumbai, etc), Delhi, Punjab, etc.</li></ul>

    </div>
</div><small class="hide-when-compact"><i> (<a href="/wiki/Help:Maintenance_template_removal" title="Help:Maintenance template removal">Learn how and when to remove this template message</a>)</i></small></div></td></tr></tbody></table>
<table class="infobox biography vcard" style="width:22em"><tbody><tr><th colspan="2" style="text-align:center;font-size:125%;font-weight:bold"><div class="fn" style="display:inline">Nahid Angha</div></th></tr><tr><th scope="row">Occupation</th><td class="role">Scholar, activist, lecturer, translator, and author</td></tr></tbody></table>
<p><b>Nahid Angha</b> is a <a href="/wiki/Sufism" title="Sufism">Sufi</a> scholar, author, lecturer and <a href="/wiki/Human_rights_activist" class="mw-redirect" title="Human rights activist"> human-rights activist</a>. She is the co-director and co-founder of the <a href="/wiki/International_Association_of_Sufism" title="International Association of Sufism">International Association of Sufism</a> (IAS),<sup id="cite_ref-Founders_1-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Founders-1">&#91;1&#93;</a></sup> founder of the International Sufi Women Organization,<sup id="cite_ref-SWO_2-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SWO-2">&#91;2&#93;</a></sup> the executive editor of the journal <i>Sufism: An Inquiry</i>,<sup id="cite_ref-SufismJournal_3-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SufismJournal-3">&#91;3&#93;</a></sup> the main representative of the IAS to the <a href="/wiki/United_Nations" title="United Nations">United Nations</a> (for Non Governmental Organization with the Department of Public Information: <a href="/wiki/United_Nations_Department_of_Public_Information" class="mw-redirect" title="United Nations Department of Public Information">NGO/DPI</a>),<sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">&#91;<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed"><span title="This claim needs references to reliable sources. (June 2018)">citation needed</span></a></i>&#93;</sup> and the creator of the Building Bridges of Understanding Series.<sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4">&#91;4&#93;</a></sup> She has written over twenty published books and many articles, and has lectured on Sufism, <a href="/wiki/Spirituality" title="Spirituality">spirituality</a>, human rights and peace at the United Nations; at the <a href="/wiki/Smithsonian_Institution" title="Smithsonian Institution">Smithsonian Institution</a>; at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Science_and_Spirituality,_Italy&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Science and Spirituality, Italy (page does not exist)">Science and Spirituality, Italy</a>;<sup id="cite_ref-ETH_Cortona_5-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ETH_Cortona-5">&#91;5&#93;</a></sup> at the Council for a <a href="/wiki/Parliament_of_the_World%27s_Religions" title="Parliament of the World&#39;s Religions">Parliament of the World's Religions</a> (CPWR) conferences in Cape Town,<sup id="cite_ref-CRSCapetown_6-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CRSCapetown-6">&#91;6&#93;</a></sup> and in Barcelona;<sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">&#91;<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed"><span title="This claim needs references to reliable sources. (June 2018)">citation needed</span></a></i>&#93;</sup> <a href="/wiki/UNESCO" title="UNESCO">UNESCO</a>'s culture of peace conference in Mexico,<sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">&#91;<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed"><span title="This claim needs references to reliable sources. (June 2018)">citation needed</span></a></i>&#93;</sup> among others. She was among the distinguished Sufi leaders and scholars invited to gather for the first annual Shakir World Encounters in Marrakesh, Morocco in 2004.<sup class="noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact" style="white-space:nowrap;">&#91;<i><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed" title="Wikipedia:Citation needed"><span title="This claim needs references to reliable sources. (June 2018)">citation needed</span></a></i>&#93;</sup>  She is the first Muslim woman inducted to the Marin Women's Hall of Fame,<sup id="cite_ref-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-7">&#91;7&#93;</a></sup> honored at <a href="/w/index.php?title=Visionary_Marin&amp;action=edit&amp;redlink=1" class="new" title="Visionary Marin (page does not exist)">Visionary Marin</a> in 2012 by the Marin Interfaith Council,<sup id="cite_ref-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-8">&#91;8&#93;</a></sup> and the <i><a href="/wiki/Huffington_Post" class="mw-redirect" title="Huffington Post">Huffington Post</a></i> named her as one of the 50 Powerful Women Religious Leaders To Celebrate On International Women's Day, 2014.<sup id="cite_ref-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9">&#91;9&#93;</a></sup> She has been an active advocate for human rights with a focus on <a href="/wiki/Women%27s_rights" title="Women&#39;s rights">women's rights</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-WhiteFire_10-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-WhiteFire-10">&#91;10&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div id="toc" class="toc" role="navigation" aria-labelledby="mw-toc-heading"><input type="checkbox" role="button" id="toctogglecheckbox" class="toctogglecheckbox" style="display:none" /><div class="toctitle" lang="en" dir="ltr"><h2 id="mw-toc-heading">Contents</h2><span class="toctogglespan"><label class="toctogglelabel" for="toctogglecheckbox"></label></span></div>
